description: Following the security update associated with CVE-2024-9956, users of Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) version 130.0.2849.46 may experience instability in browser performance. Symptoms may include unexpected crashes when accessing web pages that utilize web authentication features, leading to user frustration and potential disruption in workflow. Some users may also encounter an increase in loading times for websites, especially those leveraging complex authentication protocols. This instability particularly affects systems relying on older versions of the browser that have not yet adopted the latest fix outlined in KB-130.0.2849.46. It is essential for administrators to ensure users are promptly updated to correct build versions to mitigate these issues.
